speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God... breathtaking.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, don't be greedy!  Your turn was over forty seconds ago!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right, Niles, all right. [_steps away_] It's the penthouse unit, fourth from the left.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking_] Oh, mama!

speaker: Martin
text: You two know that what you're doing isn't right, don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: We're simply admiring a very rare Brancusi armchair, not a naked woman.

speaker: Martin
text: That's what I'm talking about.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: Evening.

speaker: Martin
text: You're home kind of early, aren't you?

speaker: Daphne
text: A bit.  Something... sort of happened.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah?  What?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, Joe and I were having dinner.  Everything was nice as could be, and I said, "Don't you like your potato?"  And he said, "No, I'm not hungry for potato just now."  So I said, "Well, if you don't like your potato you're welcome to try my potato"--

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne?  Could we hasten to the post-potato portion of the dialogue?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that's when he said it.  He said we'd been "on-again, off-again" for too long without making anything permanent, so maybe it was best if we just broke up.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, gosh, I'm sorry.  You're sure taking it well.  Boy, if you'd have told me Joe would end up dumping you tonight, I'd have been--

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, God.  He dumped me!

speaker: Martin
text: Somebody comfort her!

speaker: Niles
text: Right!  _He moves to hug Daphne, obviously anxious for the opportunity.  But Frasier gets there first.  She cries against his shoulder._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, this is so embarrassing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, never mind about that.  Expressing our emotions is always beneficial, even if it does come at the expense of our pride [_she blows her nose on his lapel_] and a very expensive brand-new Italian silk jacket.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I don't seem to be doing much good here.  Why don't one of you give it a try?

speaker: Niles
text: Very well.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, Daphne, it's all right.  You're better off without him. That guy was a bum.

speaker: Daphne
text: He was the best thing in my life!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  Well, maybe you two weren't meant for each other, you know?  I mean, you're a champagne-and-caviar sort of gal, he's a meat-and-potatoes guy.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_crying at the memory_] Potatoes!

speaker: Martin
text: I'm messing up, too.

speaker: Niles
text: I've got it, Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll get it! _She moves away, leaving Niles very frustrated.  She opens the door to Roz._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_a cry of pain_] Roz...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God, you got dumped! [_hugs her; over her shoulder, to Frasier_] Did you make her answer the door?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's what she does!

speaker: Roz
text: [_to Daphne_] Oh, it's all right, come on.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry about this.  I guess I'm still at the point where I can't hear his name without crying.

speaker: Niles
text: You hear that, everyone?  No one mention the name "Joe!"  _Daphne starts crying again.  Niles eagerly moves in, but Frasier holds him back and bats his arm.  Roz takes Daphne to her room._

speaker: Frasier
text: Brandy, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, yes.  Thank you.  Frasier?  I've just made an important decision.  I'm going to tell Daphne how I feel about her.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm going to tell her tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're serious about this?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm dead serious.  Maris and I are nowhere near reconciling. I know this is the right decision, because I'm completely calm about it.  Look. _He holds out his hand to show that it's steady.  However, the other hand, which is resting on Frasier's African sculpture, shakes violently, rattling the statue._

speaker: Niles
text: Perhaps I'll take that brandy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, before you do anything this rash, you should consider it first from all angles.

speaker: Niles
text: I've spent three years considering Daphne from all angles.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm just not sure this is the right moment for this.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, if you're trying to rattle me it's not going to work.  I've been rehearsing this for months.  "Daphne, there's something I need to talk to you about.  It's a matter of... Daphne, for a long time now, uh... you and I, we" -- exactly how's the brandy getting here, by St. Bernard?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I just think that you should consider Daphne's state of mind.  She's still reeling from her breakup with Joe. Listen, why don't you give it one more day?

speaker: Niles
text: A day?

speaker: Frasier
text: A day.  Just one day, please!  You've waited this long, another day won't make a difference.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.

speaker: Roz
text: Now, Daphne, if the jewelry wasn't that good and the sex wasn't that good, what have you really lost here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dr. Roz wades in with the "Gabor approach" to therapy!

speaker: Roz
text: I am taking Daphne out and getting her mind off her troubles. Here's your tape. [_puts it on the table_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you, Roz.

speaker: Daphne
text: I want to thank you both for being so supportive.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, nonsense.  You know, after three years, you're really a member of the family.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_still crying_] I'll get it.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's what she does! _FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Frasier's Apartment The next morning.  Martin is reading the paper at the table, Frasier is looking through his CD's._

speaker: Martin
text: What are the Sonics thinking last night?  If you're two for fifteen from behind the arc, why do you still give it to your two-guard instead of jamming it down to your big man in the paint?

speaker: Frasier
text: Eddie, I believe that question was directed at you.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, if you took an interest in sports, I bet you'd end up enjoying it.  It's got drama, it's got graceful stuff...

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Dad, but frankly I'm quite satisfied with the likes of Pavorotti's _Pagliacci_.  You have your big man in the paint, I have mine. _The doorbell rings.  Frasier opens the door to Niles, who is holding a large bouquet of flowers against his chest._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Either your boutonniere is way over the top, or you're here to execute last night's plan.

speaker: Niles
text: Look, I know I don't have your total support in this, but... how shall I put this?

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't care?

speaker: Niles
text: If you could work the phrase "rat's ass" into there, you'd have it.  The fact is, I'm tired of being lonely, and it makes no sense going on being lonely when the woman I long for is unattached.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, as I said to you at the time you tried to jump out of the tree house with an umbrella, "I suppose you know what you're doing."

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_answering_] Hello?  Oh, just a second, please.  Dad, is Daphne in her room?

speaker: Martin
text: Gee, I don't know. [_screaming_] DAPHNE!  HEY, DAPH!  DAPHNE!

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, I can yell! [_into phone_] Would you hold, please?

speaker: Martin
text: I've been waiting thirty years to do that.

speaker: Niles
text: You're probably wondering what I'm doing with these flowers.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, now that you mention it--

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'll tell you.  They're for Daphne.  I'm going to tell her how I feel about her.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's great, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: "That's great?"

speaker: Martin
text: Well, yeah.  You're single now.  She's single.  What's the problem?

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing_] That's so funny.

speaker: Martin
text: What is?

speaker: Niles
text: That's just not the reaction I expected.  I thought you'd say something more Dad-like, like...

speaker: Martin
text: You're out of your mind?

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing_] Yes.

speaker: Martin
text: She's never gonna go for it in a million years?

speaker: Niles
text: [_still laughing_] Stop it!

speaker: Martin
text: Someday you're gonna look back on this as the stupidest, most idiotic--

speaker: Niles
text: [_not laughing_] I said stop it, Dad.  _Daphne and Frasier come out.  Niles gets up and coyly hides the flowers behind his back._

speaker: Daphne
text: Morning, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't you look nice. [_picks up phone_] Hello?  Yes, Rodney, I'm so glad you called!  Yes, I enjoyed meeting you too.  Oh, well, yes, that would be lovely.  I'll see you around four, then.  Bye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Rodney?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, you won't believe this.  Last night, Roz insisted on taking me to this bar she calls "The Sure Thing."

speaker: Frasier
text: How flattering.  They've named a bar after her.

speaker: Daphne
text: She says that whenever she takes a friend there, they always end up meeting someone.  Well, I wasn't there ten minutes when she spun my barstool around and I was face-to-face with this nice-looking man.

speaker: Martin
text: Rodney?

speaker: Daphne
text: Right!  I suppose it's a bit soon for me to be seeing anyone else.  But, if I wait, he might not be available when I'm ready.

speaker: Niles
text: Timing is everything.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't wait to tell Roz!

speaker: Niles
text: "Give it a day, Niles."  I believe that was your brilliant advice?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Niles, I really am.  I don't know what to say.

speaker: Niles
text: [_dropping the flowers on the table_] Too bad you didn't have that problem last night.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't let it get you down.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not going to.  I still have a fallback position. [_grabs Frasier's rolodex and starts flipping through it_] I'm going to call Roz and have her take me to that bar tonight!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, really -- a singles bar?  Please, you're not thinking clearly.  That's not exactly your arena, is it?  Listen, why don't you just give it a day and think it over... [_off Niles's glare_] Here, let me dial that for you. **WHERE EVERYBODY KNOWS HER NAME**  _Scene Three -- Granville's An upscale singles bar -- piano, bar with stools, tables.  It's sparsely populated.  Roz is sitting at the bar.  Niles comes up behind her, slightly frazzled._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm here.  I forgot to gargle, I'm wearing mismatched socks, and I'm so nervous I could wet myself.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, at least we have your opening line down.

speaker: Niles
text: You're going to have to be patient with me, Roz.  This isn't exactly my _milieu_.

speaker: Roz
text: O.K., let's make that lesson number one.  If you're going to use words like "_milieu_ ," you might as well show up here with a sore on your lip and a couple of kids.

speaker: Niles
text: Point well taken.

speaker: Roz
text: Will you sit down and relax? [_he sits next to her_] You're gonna be fine.  There's just a few little rules you need to know.  First, when you introduce yourself, be as casual as possible.  Second, you cannot say enough nice things about her hair.  I know that sounds shallow, but it really works.  And third, hang on her every word -- be fascinated.  Now go.

speaker: Niles
text: What do you mean, "go"?

speaker: Roz
text: It's time.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not ready.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I've thrown a lot of little babies in the water and they've all come up swimming.  Now go.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I couldn't possibly, not yet, I need to--  _She spins his barstool around, bringing him face-to-face with an attractive blond woman (Adelle)._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Adelle
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Hope I'm not bothering you.

speaker: Adelle
text: No, not at all.  I'm Adelle.

speaker: Niles
text: Niles. [_shakes her hand_] So, "Adelle"... is that with one "l" or two?

speaker: Adelle
text: Two.

speaker: Niles
text: [_fascinated_] _Really?_  _He props an elbow up on the bar and rests his head on his hand. Roz smiles, thinking, "I've thrown him off the roof and he's flying!"  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  **STAREMASTER**  _Scene Four -- Frasier's Apartment It's evening.  Frasier and Eddie are seated opposite each other at the dinner table, having a stare-down contest.  Martin comes out._

speaker: Martin
text: You're wasting your time.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm not.

speaker: Martin
text: You're not gonna win.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's time he learned what it's like to be stared at all the time.  Bring it on, Buster, you got _nothing_.  You can't touch me, I'm -- Gaah! [_breaks away, clutching his eyes_] It's like his eyes turned into sorcerer's pinwheels and started spinning!

speaker: Martin
text: Just shake hands and say "good fight." _Frasier considers doing it for a second, then decides not. Martin opens the door to Niles and Adelle, dressed for an evening out._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi, Niles!  Come on in.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, this is Adelle Childs -- my father Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Nice to meet you. [_shakes her hand_]

speaker: Niles
text: And this is my brother, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's so nice to finally meet you.

speaker: Adelle
text: Nice to meet you.

speaker: Niles
text: Are you all right?  Your eyes look funny.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm fine, it's just -- oh, here are your tickets. [_gives them to Niles_]

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, have you got time for a coffee before you go?

speaker: Adelle
text: That'd be nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Splendid!  Gives me a chance to debut my Limoges coffee set -- a series of six unique cups, each one representing a different wife of Henry VIII.  My antique dealer just found an "Anne of Cleves" to complete the set!

speaker: Martin
text: He loves to rub it in.  I'm still looking for a "Wilma" to complete my juice glass set.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll lend you a hand. [_to Adelle_] Excuse me.

speaker: Niles
text: So, what do you think?

speaker: Frasier
text: She seems very nice.

speaker: Niles
text: She's fabulous.  I know it's only been three dates, but I feel as though I've been rescued.  I no longer have to worry about becoming one of those pitiful losers embittered by a failed marriage, leading a lonely pathetic life of... [_off Frasier's withering look_] fulfillment and good times!

speaker: Frasier
text: Shouldn't you make a beeping noise when you back up like that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, coffee will be ready in a moment.

speaker: Adelle
text: So what were you two whispering about?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, nothing -- just how, whenever you think you have your life figured out, something unexpected happens.

speaker: Daphne
text: Sorry, forgot my keys.  Hello, all.  Oh, everyone, this is Rodney Banks. _In steps a man who is Niles's Doppleganger -- same height, same figure, same haircut, same neat suit, same rigid posture -- the sole difference is that his hair is brown._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Niles Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: How do you do?

speaker: Rodney
text: The pleasure is mine. _They shake hands.  In a perfect mirror of each other, they then take out handkerchiefs and wipe their palms.  Frasier and Martin stare. Daphne, standing in the middle, doesn't seem to notice._

speaker: Rodney
text: Flu season.

speaker: Niles
text: Can't be too careful.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, this is Dr. Frasier Crane, and his father Martin.  And...

speaker: Niles
text: This is Adelle Childs.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Adelle
text: Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, we've just had the most wonderful day at the marina.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you get a boat?

speaker: Rodney
text: Actually, no.  I have an inner-ear curvature that makes me prone to motion sickness. [_Martin looks at Frasier, incredulous_] But there's a charming bistro there that serves the most exquisite-- _A phone rings.  Mirroring each other again, Niles and Rodney take out cell phones and flip them open._

speaker: Niles
text: Not me.

speaker: Rodney
text: Not me.

speaker: Martin
text: Hello?  Oh, I can't talk right now, Duke.  I'm in the Twilight Zone. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Would, uh, you like a coffee?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh yes, that would be lovely.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll give you a hand, Frasier!  _Martin gets up and follows Frasier into the kitchen. As soon as they make it in:_

speaker: Frasier/Martin
text: ** What the hell was that?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I think maybe we should put a little red mark on the real Niles so we can tell them apart!

speaker: Martin
text: Niles must be going nuts!

speaker: Niles
text: Can I lend you a hand?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh no, that's fine, Niles. [_Niles turns to go_] Oh, wait, wait a minute!  So, uh... what do you think of Rodney?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, so far I'm not impressed.  Bit of a pretentious fop, wouldn't you say?

speaker: Martin
text: He doesn't, uh, remind you of anyone?

speaker: Niles
text: Remind me of anyone...

speaker: Rodney
text: So sorry, but about my coffee?  I neglected to mention that I like my milk steamed, with just a dollop of foam, such as might give the impression of a cumulus cloud reflected in a still pond.

speaker: Niles
text: Consider it done.

speaker: Niles
text: I want to kill myself!

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, Niles, it's funny!

speaker: Niles
text: No!  It's not remotely funny!  Frasier talked me out of approaching Daphne on the same night she fell for that man!

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't possibly be mad at me!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, Frasier, I'm grateful. [_grabs a kitchen knife_] Come here, let me show you how grateful I am!

speaker: Martin
text: [_getting in his way_] Niles, calm down!

speaker: Daphne
text: Isn't Rodney just great? [_everyone agrees_] You know, I think it was the moment I broke up with Joe that I heard a voice saying, "Daphne, it's time you went for a completely new type of man."

speaker: Niles
text: You're a dead man!

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's serve our guests their coffee!

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are, coffee.  Milk's on its way, Niles is still steaming.

speaker: Rodney
text: Nothing smells quite so heavenly as a freshly brewed cup of coffee.  Well, perhaps one thing does.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, stop that! [_laughing_] He just loves to smell my hair!  _There's a crash from the kitchen.  Frasier winces.  Martin thinks, "Uh-Oh."_

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stricken_] Anne Boleyn?

speaker: Niles
text: [_o.s._] Catherine of Aragon. _FADE TO:  Scene Five -- Cafe Nervosa Niles is sitting at a table with his back to the door.  Frasier comes in.  Niles notices him, then looks away._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for heaven's sake, Niles.  You don't take my calls, you ignore me.  For God's sake, it's the behavior of a pouting adolescent. [_sits down_] Are you quite finished now? [_realizes_] You put gum on my chair, didn't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Yep.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_removing the gum_] Niles, listen: I am terribly sorry if I steered you wrong.  But just think about it.  You do have a wonderful new woman in your life now, don't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I--I suppose I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: And Adelle does make you very happy, doesn't she?

speaker: Niles
text: [_perking up_] Yes. [_chuckles_] Yes, she does.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then, if you've ever taken any of my advice before, take this: Adelle may very well be the path to your happiness.  _No sooner are the words out of his mouth than Adelle comes into the caf e, on the arm of Rodney.  They sit in a corner booth together. Niles doesn't see them._

speaker: Frasier
text: But let's say I'm wrong...

speaker: Niles
text: But-but you're not wrong.  Adelle is a wonderful, affectionate woman.

speaker: Niles
text: She's clearly drawn to a man of my type.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm.

speaker: Niles
text: Just thinking about her lifts my spirits.  Frasier... thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, uh... [_sighs_] look.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't believe it!  The betrayal!  No one treats Daphne like that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  Whatever you do, do not engage him in a physical fight.  The whole thing would just look too weird!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Adelle.

speaker: Adelle
text: [_startled_] Oh no.

speaker: Rodney
text: I know this may look a tad incriminating, but the truth is--

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, spare me, you ludicrous popinjay.  I know exactly what's going on here, I saw the whole thing from my table.

speaker: Adelle
text: I was going to call you!  You see, Rodney and I... I'm sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: So am I, Adelle.  But I'm mainly sorry for Daphne.  How do you intend to handle that small matter?

speaker: Rodney
text: I was planning on telling her this evening at Granville's. We're meeting for drinks.

speaker: Niles
text: Granville's... why don't you do her a favor?  Let me tell her. It might be better coming from a friend.

speaker: Rodney
text: Yes, perhaps you're right.  Please tell her that I'm sorry. Sometimes, when a man meets the woman that he's meant to be with, [_clasps Adelle's hand affectionately_] there's nothing he can do to resist it.  I hope Daphne understands that.

speaker: Niles
text: I hope she understands it too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Rodney... [_growling_] Adelle.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, there's just one thing I'd like to ask you, Rodney: do you have an older brother?

speaker: Rodney
text: As a matter of fact, I do.  He's always been the pride of the family -- handsome, successful, brilliant.  I've always been rather jealous of him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Spooky.  _He leaves.  Rodney and Adelle look somewhat puzzled.  FADE TO:  Scene Six -- Granville's That evening.  Daphne is sitting at the bar with a glass of red wine. Niles comes in._

speaker: Niles
text: Evening, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: You don't seem surprised to see me.

speaker: Daphne
text: I was running late, so I called Rodney on his cell phone. He told me everything.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  I'm sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry for you, too. [_raising her glass_] Join me in a little sorrow-drowning?

speaker: Niles
text: I believe I will. [_to bartender_] One more of these, please. [_the bartender pours him a glass of wine_] Thank you. [_to Daphne_] Well, I can't really blame Adelle.  Rodney's that sort of man that women seem to go for.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sadly_] Yes, he is.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to upset you.

speaker: Daphne
text: You didn't.  I guess I'm just in more of a mood to hear about his negative qualities right now.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, he's a bit of a know-it-all, a bit fussy...

speaker: Daphne
text: Has to have everything just so, he's nuts about cleanliness, then there's his clothes, his precious shoes--

speaker: Niles
text: I don't like this road we're on.  I mean, wouldn't it be better if we discussed what's in our futures?

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose so.  I'll tell you one thing.  After the run I've had, I pity the next man I date.  I'd probably rip him to shreds.

speaker: Niles
text: What about the man after that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Men can be such an unfeeling lot.  Look at Rodney -- the moment he heard I'd just broken up with someone, he moved right in for the kill.  Is that how all men are?

speaker: Niles
text: No, not all men.

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course they aren't.  You're not.  You're kind, sensitive -- you ask me, you were too good for that Adelle.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Daphne.  You know, the truth is my heart was never really in that relationship.

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought it might not be.

speaker: Niles
text: There was someone else who was too much on my mind.

speaker: Daphne
text: I had a feeling, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: You did?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.  As long as you still have feelings for your wife, you know you can't be involved with anyone else.  It makes sense to me -- I know I'd never get involved with a man who was separated.

speaker: Niles
text: Even if he'd worshipped you from the day he laid eyes on you?

speaker: Daphne
text: And don't think that's not just how they put it, too! [_laughs_] No, I think I need to do a bit of separating myself -- from Joe, I mean.  Yes, I'll wait a good long time before I do anymore dating.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm glad to hear that.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_chuckling_] You know, it's funny when you think about it -- the two of us coming to this same singles bar this week? Why, this was the very stool I was on when I met Rodney.

speaker: Niles
text: I was sitting here when I met Adelle. [_she chuckles again_] What?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I was just thinking.  If it'd been a different time in both our lives, we might actually have met.  How do you suppose that would have gone?

speaker: Niles
text: What, our conversation?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, come on!  Just for fun -- we could both use a smile.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, uh... first I would have said, "Is this seat taken?" And you would have said, "no."  You would have said, "my name is Daphne," and I would have said "my name is Niles."  And then I would have said... "What are you doing for the rest of your life?"

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughing_] You always know just what to say. [_then, as a friend would say it_] Oh, I love you, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: I love you too, Daphne.
